forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
The only one I would **not** recommend is Patriot Rage 32GB Flash drive - many systems seem to have intermittent problems booting from this key (at least my one). Often the system will completely freeze during POST until the Patriot is removed and then will halt again if it is re-inserted! On some systems the keyboard won't work after booting from this key. I have not had any such problems with any other of my keys.  

For a recommendation, I would recommend a Lexar Jumpdrive (or similar) because BootIt,exe will flip the bit on these. This can be useful for some systems which don't boot from a removable drive.  
For any other I would strongly suggest a USB 3 flash drive - these are faster than most USB 2 drives when connected to a USB **2** port and so are worth it even if you don't have a system with USB 3 ports (yet).  

USB 3 drives I have are a BUSBI 16GB and a Pretec 8GB.- I have not had any trouble from these so far and they are pretty fast too.
